Subject: How to Create a New Processor to Write Another Destination
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=483969598; y=8z1SbWkTQ_gDwEXfBc3-opIq0LGyVuWMXOCqqAHwc5s32B5BpZUW2Qw
From: kyle adams <adamskf@...>


--089e0111dfcad7b50c052c9b7107
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8

I'd like to extend Heritrix to write WARCs to another destination other
than to disk. Specifically, I would like to create a processor that writes
to a CMIS (
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Content_Management_Interoperability_Services)
compliant content repository.

I found the following developer docs, but is specific to extraction and not
writing to a target destination:
http://crawler.archive.org/articles/developer_manual/processor.html

I also found an HDFS example on GitHub:
https://github.com/openplaces/heritrix-hdfs-writer

I'm pretty much a newb, but looking for the group to point me in the right
direction and validate that I'm looking at the right resources.

Thanks,
Kyle

--089e0111dfcad7b50c052c9b7107
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
